Tanks

Class Projectile

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tanks.Projectile

  • public class Projectile
extends java.lang.Object
    The Projectile class represents a projectile fired by a tank. It handles the physics of the projectile's motion, including gravity and wind effects, and checks for collisions with the terrain.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Projectile(PVector start, PVector initialVelocity, float wind, Tank owner)
      Constructs a new Projectile object.

    • Method Summary

      Displays the projectile on the screen.

      boolean isActive()
      Checks if the projectile is active.
      void setImpactListener(Tanks.ImpactListener listener)
      Sets the impact listener for the projectile.
      void update(int[] terrainHeights)
      Updates the projectile's position based on its velocity, gravity, and wind effects.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Projectile

        public Projectile(PVector start,
                  PVector initialVelocity,
                  float wind,
                  Tank owner)
        Constructs a new Projectile object.
        Parameters:
        start - The starting position of the projectile.
        initialVelocity - The initial velocity of the projectile.
        wind - The wind effect on the projectile.
        owner - The tank that fired the projectile.

    • Method Detail

      • setImpactListener

        public void setImpactListener(Tanks.ImpactListener listener)
        Sets the impact listener for the projectile.
        Parameters:
        listener - The impact listener to be set.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Checks if the projectile is active.
        Returns:
        True if the projectile is active, otherwise false.

      • update

        public void update(int[] terrainHeights)
        Updates the projectile's position based on its velocity, gravity, and wind effects. Checks for collisions with the terrain and triggers the impact event if necessary.
        Parameters:
        terrainHeights - The heights of the terrain at different x-coordinates.

      • getPosition

        public PVector getPosition()

      • display

        public void display(PApplet app)
        Displays the projectile on the screen.
        Parameters:
        app - The PApplet instance used for drawing.
